title: Processes - Area between Curves - Functions of y

content.description: Let <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded above by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, seven thirds x, plus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and bounded below by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, 2 to the x power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following definite integrals gives the area of region <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
content.question: <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 3, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, seven thirds x, plus 1, close parenthesis, minus 2 to the x power, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 3, of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator the natural log of y, and denominator the natural log of 2, end fraction, minus three sevenths times, open parenthesis, y minus 1, close parenthesis, close parenthesis, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 8, of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator the natural log of y, and denominator the natural log of 2, end fraction, minus three sevenths times, open parenthesis, y minus 1, close parenthesis, close parenthesis, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.5: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of y

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
